question: Find the correct statement.
(1) Generally a gene regulates a trait, but sometimes one gene has effect on multiple traits.
(2) The trait AB-blood group of man is regulated by one dominant allele and another recessive allele. Hence it is co-dominant.
choices: Statement (1) is correct. Statement (2) is incorrect.
Statement (1) is incorrect. Statement (2) is correct.
explanation: Statement (1) is correct (Pleiotropy). Statement (2) is incorrect because AB blood group is an example of co-dominance where both alleles (<katex>$I^A$</katex> and <katex>$I^B$</katex>) are dominant and express themselves fully.
